   20: -module(compile_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Tests compile:file/1 and compile:file/2 with various options.
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("stdlib/include/erl_compile.hrl").
   26: 
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   28: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   29: 	 app_test/1,appup_test/1,bigE_roundtrip/1,
   30: 	 debug_info/4, custom_debug_info/1, custom_compile_info/1,
   31: 	 file_1/1, forms_2/1, module_mismatch/1, outdir/1,
   32: 	 binary/1, makedep/1, cond_and_ifdef/1, listings/1, listings_big/1,
   33: 	 other_output/1, encrypted_abstr/1,
   34: 	 strict_record/1, utf8_atoms/1, utf8_functions/1, extra_chunks/1,
   35: 	 cover/1, env/1, core_pp/1, tuple_calls/1,
   36: 	 core_roundtrip/1, asm/1, asm_labels/1,
   37: 	 sys_pre_attributes/1, dialyzer/1, no_core_prepare/1,
   38: 	 warnings/1, pre_load_check/1, env_compiler_options/1,
   39:          bc_options/1, deterministic_include/1, deterministic_paths/1,
   40:          compile_attribute/1, message_printing/1, other_options/1,
   41:          transforms/1, erl_compile_api/1, types_pp/1, bs_init_writable/1,
   42:          annotations_pp/1
   43: 	]).
   44: 
   45: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   46: 
   47: %% To cover the stripping of 'type' and 'spec' in beam_asm.
   48: -type all_return_type() :: [atom()].
   49: -spec all() -> all_return_type().
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [app_test, appup_test, bigE_roundtrip, file_1,
   53:      forms_2, module_mismatch, outdir,
   54:      binary, makedep, cond_and_ifdef, listings, listings_big,
   55:      other_output, encrypted_abstr, tuple_calls,
   56:      strict_record, utf8_atoms, utf8_functions, extra_chunks,
   57:      cover, env, core_pp, core_roundtrip, asm, asm_labels, no_core_prepare,
   58:      sys_pre_attributes, dialyzer, warnings, pre_load_check,
   59:      env_compiler_options, custom_debug_info, bc_options,
   60:      custom_compile_info, deterministic_include, deterministic_paths,
   61:      compile_attribute, message_printing, other_options, transforms,
   62:      erl_compile_api, types_pp, bs_init_writable, annotations_pp].
   63: 
   64: groups() -> 
   65:     [].
   66: 
   67: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   68:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   72:     ok.
   73: 
   74: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   75: 	Config.
   76: 
   77: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   78: 	Config.
   79: 
   80: 
   81: 
   82: %% Test that the Application file has no `basic' errors.";
   83: app_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   84:     test_server:app_test(compiler).
   85: 
   86: %% Test that the Application upgrade file has no `basic' errors.";
   87: appup_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   88:     ok = test_server:appup_test(compiler).
   89: 
   90: %% Check that a file compiled to the abstract form and dumped with -E
   91: %% can be compiled. We use a file constructed to produce errors if the
   92: %% dumping fails to legalize compiler generated variable names.
   93: bigE_roundtrip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   94:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   95:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   96:     Source = filename:join(DataDir, "bigE.erl"),
   97:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "bigE"),
   98:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, "bigE.E"),
   99:     TargetSource = filename:join(TargetDir, "bigE.erl"),
  100:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  101:     io:format("Source: ~p~nTargetDir: ~p~nTarget: ~p\n",
  102:               [Source, TargetDir, Target]),
  103:     case compile:file(Source,
  104:                       ['E', warnings_as_errors, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  105:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  106:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other})
  107:     end,
  108:     %% Rename the output to .erl so that the compiler accepts it and
  109:     %% we won't get a warning due to the filename not matching the
  110:     %% module name.
  111:     ok = file:rename(Target, TargetSource),
  112:     case compile:file(TargetSource,
  113:                       [warnings_as_errors, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  114:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  115:         Other1 -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other1})
  116:     end,
  117:     file:delete(TargetSource),
  118:     file:del_dir(TargetDir),
  119:     ok.
  120: 
  121: %% Tests that we can compile and run a simple Erlang program,
  122: %% using compile:file/1.
  123: 
  124: file_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  125:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  126: 
  127:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  128:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  129: 
  130:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  131:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  132:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:dirname(Target)),
  133: 
  134:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [slim]), %Smoke test only.
  135:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple),	%Smoke test only.
  136: 
  137:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, []),
  138:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, [debug_info]),
  139:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, [no_postopt]),
  140: 
  141:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [no_line_info]), %Coverage
  142:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{eprof,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  143:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{call_time,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  144:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{call_memory,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  145: 
  146:     %% Cover option not in a list (undocumented feature).
  147:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, no_postopt),
  148: 
  149:     %% Test compiling from an .abstr file.
  150:     {ok,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [dabstr]),
  151:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(filename:rootname(Target), [from_abstr]),
  152:     ok = file:delete(filename:rootname(Target) ++ ".abstr"),
  153: 
  154:     %% Test option 'deterministic'.
  155:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [deterministic]),
  156:     {module,simple} = c:l(simple),
  157:     [{version,_}] = simple:module_info(compile),
  158:     true = code:delete(simple),
  159:     false = code:purge(simple),
  160: 
  161:     ok = file:set_cwd(Cwd),
  162:     true = exists(Target),
  163:     passed = run(Target, test, []),
  164: 
  165:     %% Test option 'deterministic' as a compiler attribute.
  166:     Det = deterministic_module,
  167:     {DetPath, DetTarget} = get_files(Config, Det, "det_target"),
  168:     {ok,Det,DetCode} = compile:file(DetPath, [binary]),
  169:     {module,Det} = code:load_binary(Det, "", DetCode),
  170:     [{version,_}] = Det:module_info(compile),
  171:     true = code:delete(Det),
  172:     false = code:purge(Det),
  173: 
  174:     %% Cover error handling code.
  175:     NonExisting = definitely__no__such__module,
  176:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [report]),
  177:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_abstr,report]),
  178:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_core,report]),
  179:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_asm,report]),
  180: 
  181:     error = compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "bad_core"), [from_core,report]),
  182:     error = compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "bad_core_tokens"), [from_core,report]),
  183: 
  184:     %% Cover handling of obsolete options.
  185:     ObsoleteOptions = [r18,r19,r20,r21,r22,r23,
  186:                        no_bsm3,no_get_hd_tl,no_put_tuple2,no_utf8_atoms,
  187:                        no_swap,no_init_yregs,no_shared_fun_wrappers,no_make_fun3],
  188:     _ = [begin
  189:              {error,[{_Simple,
  190:                       [{none,compile,{obsolete_option,Opt}}]}],
  191:               []} =
  192:                  compile:file(Simple, [Opt,return]),
  193:              error = compile:file(Simple, [Opt,report])
  194:          end || Opt <- ObsoleteOptions],
  195: 
  196:     %% Create a directory with the same name as the temp file to cover
  197:     %% handling of write errors.
  198:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
  199:     SimpleTempFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.bea#"),
  200:     SimpleOutputFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.beam"),
  201:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  202:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleOutputFile),
  203:     try
  204:         error = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir,PrivDir}, report]),
  205:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  206:         error = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir,PrivDir}, report])
  207:     after
  208:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  209:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleOutputFile)
  210:     end,
  211: 
  212:     %% Cleanup.
  213:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  214:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  215:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(DetTarget)),
  216: 
  217:     %% There should not be any messages in the messages.
  218:     receive
  219: 	Any ->
  220: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Any})
  221:     after 10 ->
  222: 	    ok
  223:     end,
  224: 
  225:     ok.
  226: 
  227: forms_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  228:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  229:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  230: 
  231:     Src = Simple,
  232:     AbsSrc = filename:absname(Src),
  233:     {ok,[],SimpleCode} = compile:file(Simple, [dabstr,binary]),
  234: 
  235:     {ok,simple,Bin1} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [binary,{source,Src}]),
  236:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:forms(SimpleCode,
  237:                                   [binary,{error_location,line},{source,Src}]),
  238: 
  239:     %% Cover option not in a list (undocumented feature).
  240:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, no_postopt),
  241: 
  242:     %% Load and test that the proper source is returned.
  243:     AbsSrc = forms_load_code(simple, Src, Bin1),
  244: 
  245:     %% Work in a deleted directory.
  246:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  247:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  248:     ok = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  249:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  250:     case os:type() of
  251: 	{unix,_} -> os:cmd("rm -rf " ++ WorkDir);
  252: 	_ -> ok
  253:     end,
  254:     {ok,simple,Bin2} = compile:forms(SimpleCode),
  255:     undefined = forms_load_code(simple, "ignore", Bin2),
  256: 
  257:     {ok,simple,Bin3} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [{source,Src},report]),
  258:     case forms_load_code(simple, "ignore", Bin3) of
  259: 	Src ->					%Unix.
  260: 	    ok;
  261: 	AbsSrc ->				%Windows.
  262: 	    ok
  263:     end,
  264: 
  265:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [to_core0,binary]),
  266:     forms_compile_and_load(Core, [from_core]),
  267: 
  268:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [to_asm,binary]),
  269:     forms_compile_and_load(Asm, [from_asm]),
  270: 
  271:     %% The `from_abstr` option is redundant when compiling from forms,
  272:     %% but it should work.
  273:     forms_compile_and_load(SimpleCode, [from_abstr]),
  274: 
  275:     %% Cover the error handling code.
  276:     error = compile:forms(bad_core, [from_core,report]),
  277:     error = compile:forms(bad_asm, [from_asm,report]),
  278: 
  279:     ok.
  280: 
  281: 
  282: forms_load_code(Mod, Src, Bin) ->
  283:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Src, Bin),
  284:     Info = Mod:module_info(compile),
  285:     SourceOption = proplists:get_value(source, Info),
  286: 
  287:     %% Ensure that the options are not polluted with 'source'.
  288:     [] = proplists:get_value(options, Info),
  289: 
  290:     %% Cleanup.
  291:     true = code:delete(simple),
  292:     false = code:purge(simple),
  293: 
  294:     SourceOption.
  295: 
  296: forms_compile_and_load(Code, Opts) ->
  297:     Mod = simple,
  298:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = compile:forms(Code, Opts),
  299:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "ignore", Bin),
  300:     _ = Mod:module_info(),
  301:     true = code:delete(simple),
  302:     false = code:purge(simple),
  303:     ok.
  304: 
  305: module_mismatch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  306:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  307:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "wrong_module_name.erl"),
  308:     {error,[{"wrong_module_name.beam",
  309: 	     [{none,compile,{module_name,arne,"wrong_module_name"}}]}],
  310: 	   []} = compile:file(File, [return]),
  311:     error = compile:file(File, [report]),
  312: 
  313:     {ok,arne,[]} = compile:file(File,
  314: 				      [return,no_error_module_mismatch]),
  315: 
  316:     ok.
  317: 
  318: %% Tests that the {outdir, Dir} option works.
  319: 
  320: outdir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  321:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "outdir"),
  322:     {ok, simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir, filename:dirname(Target)}]),
  323:     true = exists(Target),
  324:     passed = run(Target, test, []),
  325:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  326:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  327:     ok.
  328: 
  329: %% Tests that the binary option works.
  330: 
  331: binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  332:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "binary"),
  333:     {ok, simple, Binary} = compile:file(Simple, [binary]),
  334:     code:load_binary(simple, Target, Binary),
  335:     passed = simple:test(),
  336:     true = code:delete(simple),
  337:     false = code:purge(simple),
  338:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  339:     ok.
  340: 
  341: %% Tests that the dependencies-Makefile-related options work.
  342: 
  343: makedep(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  344:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  345:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  346: 
  347:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "makedep"),
  348:     SimpleRootname = filename:rootname(Simple),
  349:     IncludeDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple), "include"),
  350:     IncludeOptions = [
  351: 		      {d,need_foo},
  352: 		      {d,foo_value,42},
  353: 		      {d,include_generated},
  354: 		      {i,IncludeDir}
  355: 		     ],
  356: 
  357:     %% Basic rule.
  358:     BasicMf1Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-basic1.mk",
  359:     {ok,BasicMf1} = file:read_file(BasicMf1Name),
  360:     {ok,_,Mf1} = compile:file(Simple, [binary,makedep]),
  361:     BasicMf1 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf1, DataDir),
  362: 
  363:     %% Basic rule with one existing header.
  364:     BasicMf2Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-basic2.mk",
  365:     {ok,BasicMf2} = file:read_file(BasicMf2Name),
  366:     {ok,_,Mf2} = compile:file(Simple, [binary,makedep|IncludeOptions]),
  367:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf2, DataDir),
  368: 
  369:     %% Rule with one existing header and one missing header.
  370:     MissingMfName = SimpleRootname ++ "-missing.mk",
  371:     {ok,MissingMf} = file:read_file(MissingMfName),
  372:     {ok,_,Mf3} = compile:file(Simple,
  373:       [binary,makedep,makedep_add_missing|IncludeOptions]),
  374:     MissingMf = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf3, DataDir),
  375: 
  376:     %% Rule with modified target.
  377:     TargetMf1Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-target1.mk",
  378:     {ok,TargetMf1} = file:read_file(TargetMf1Name),
  379:     {ok,_,Mf4} = compile:file(Simple,
  380:       [binary,makedep,{makedep_target,"$target"}|IncludeOptions]),
  381:     TargetMf1 = makedep_modify_target(
  382:       makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf4, DataDir), "$$target"),
  383: 
  384:     %% Rule with quoted modified target.
  385:     TargetMf2Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-target2.mk",
  386:     {ok,TargetMf2} = file:read_file(TargetMf2Name),
  387:     {ok,_,Mf5} = compile:file(Simple,
  388:       [binary,makedep,{makedep_target,"$target"},makedep_quote_target|
  389:         IncludeOptions]),
  390:     TargetMf2 = makedep_modify_target(
  391:       makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf5, DataDir), "$$target"),
  392: 
  393:     %% Basic rule written to some file.
  394:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple,
  395:       [makedep,{makedep_output,Target}|IncludeOptions]),
  396:     {ok,Mf6} = file:read_file(Target),
  397:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf6, DataDir),
  398: 
  399:     %% Rule with creating phony target.
  400:     PhonyMfName = SimpleRootname ++ "-phony.mk",
  401:     {ok,PhonyMf} = file:read_file(PhonyMfName),
  402:     {ok,_,Mf7} = compile:file(Simple,
  403:       [binary,makedep,makedep_phony|IncludeOptions]),
  404:     PhonyMf = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf7, DataDir),
  405: 
  406:     %% Basic rule written to the default file.
  407:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple, [makedep|IncludeOptions]),
  408:     {ok,Mf8} = file:read_file(Target),
  409:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf8, DataDir),
  410: 
  411:     %% Generate dependencies and compile normally at the same time.
  412:     GeneratedHrl = filename:join(PrivDir, "generated.hrl"),
  413:     GeneratedDoc = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "foo.md"),
  414:     try
  415:         ok = file:write_file(GeneratedHrl, ""),
  416:         ok = file:write_file(GeneratedDoc, ""),
  417:         {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep_side_effect,
  418:                                             {makedep_output,Target},
  419:                                             {i,PrivDir}|IncludeOptions]),
  420:         {ok,Mf9} = file:read_file(Target),
  421:         BasicMf3 = iolist_to_binary([string:trim(BasicMf2), " $(srcdir)/foo.md ", filename:join(PrivDir, "generated.hrl"), "\n"]),
  422:         BasicMf3 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf9, DataDir),
  423:         error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep_side_effect,
  424:                                       {makedep_output,PrivDir}|IncludeOptions])
  425:     after
  426:         ok = file:delete(GeneratedHrl),
  427:         ok = file:delete(GeneratedDoc)
  428:     end,
  429: 
  430:     %% Cover generation of long lines that must be split.
  431:     CompileModule = filename:join(code:lib_dir(compiler), "src/compile.erl"),
  432:     {ok,_} = compile:file(CompileModule, [report,
  433:                                           makedep,{makedep_output,standard_io},
  434:                                           {i,filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib), "include")}]),
  435: 
  436:     %% Basic rule written to the standard output.
  437:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple, [makedep,{makedep_output,standard_io}|IncludeOptions]),
  438: 
  439:     %% Test error handling.
  440:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep,{makedep_output,DataDir}]),
  441:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep,{makedep_output,a_bad_output_device}]),
  442: 
  443:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  444:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  445:     ok.
  446: 
  447: makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf, DataDir) ->
  448:     Mf0 = binary_to_list(Mf),
  449:     %% Replace the Datadir by "$(srcdir)".
  450:     Mf1 = re:replace(Mf0, DataDir, "$(srcdir)/",
  451:       [global,multiline,{return,list}]),
  452:     %% Long lines are split, put back everything on one line.
  453:     Mf2 = re:replace(Mf1, "\\\\\n  ", "", [global,multiline,{return,list}]),
  454:     list_to_binary(Mf2).
  455: 
  456: makedep_modify_target(Mf, Target) ->
  457:     Mf0 = binary_to_list(Mf),
  458:     Mf1 = re:replace(Mf0, Target, "$target", [{return,list}]),
  459:     list_to_binary(Mf1).
  460: 
  461: %% Tests that conditional compilation, defining values, including files work.
  462: 
  463: no_core_prepare(_Config) ->
  464:     Mod = {c_module,[],
  465:               {c_literal,[],sample_receive},
  466:               [{c_var,[],{discard,0}}],
  467:               [],
  468:               [{{c_var,[],{discard,0}},
  469:                 {c_fun,[],[],
  470:                     {c_case,[],
  471:                         {c_values,[],[]},
  472:                         [{c_clause,[],[],
  473:                              {c_literal,[],true},
  474:                              {c_receive,[],[],{c_literal,[],0},{c_literal,[],ok}}}]}}}]},
  475: 
  476:     {ok,sample_receive,_,_} = compile:forms(Mod, [from_core,binary,return]),
  477:     {error,_,_} = compile:forms(Mod, [from_core,binary,return,no_core_prepare]),
  478:     ok.
  479: 
  480: cond_and_ifdef(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  481:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "cond_and_ifdef"),
  482:     IncludeDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple), "include"),
  483:     Options = [{outdir, filename:dirname(Target)},
  484: 		     {d, need_foo}, {d, foo_value, 42},
  485: 		     {i, IncludeDir}, report],
  486:     {ok, simple} = compile:file(Simple, Options),
  487:     true = exists(Target),
  488:     {hiker, 42} = run(Target, foo, []),
  489:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  490:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  491:     ok.
  492: 
  493: listings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  494:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  495:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  496:     ok = do_file_listings(DataDir, PrivDir, [
  497: 	    "simple",
  498: 	    "small",
  499: 	    "small_maps"
  500: 	]),
  501: 
  502:     %% Cover handling of write errors.
  503:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
  504:     SimpleTarget = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.S"),
  505:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleTarget),
  506:     try
  507:         error = compile:file(Simple, ['S', {outdir,PrivDir}, report])
  508:     after
  509:         ok = file:del_dir(SimpleTarget)
  510:     end,
  511: 
  512:     ok.
  513: 
  514: do_file_listings(_, _, []) -> ok;
  515: do_file_listings(DataDir, PrivDir, [File|Files]) ->
  516:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, File),
  517:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, listings),
  518:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  519: 
  520:     List = [{'S',".S"},
  521:             {'E',".E"},
  522:             {'P',".P"},
  523:             {dpp, ".pp"},
  524:             {dabstr, ".abstr"},
  525:             {dexp, ".expand"},
  526:             {dcore, ".core"},
  527:             {doldinline, ".oldinline"},
  528:             {dinline, ".inline"},
  529:             {dcore, ".core"},
  530:             {dcopt, ".copt"},
  531:             {dcbsm, ".core_bsm"},
  532:             {dssa, ".ssa"},
  533:             {dbool, ".bool"},
  534:             {dssashare, ".ssashare"},
  535:             {dssaopt, ".ssaopt"},
  536:             {dprecg, ".precodegen"},
  537:             {dcg, ".codegen"},
  538:             {dblk, ".block"},
  539:             {djmp, ".jump"},
  540:             {dclean, ".clean"},
  541:             {dopt, ".optimize"},
  542:             {diffable, ".S"}],
  543:     p_listings(List, Simple, TargetDir),
  544: 
  545:     %% Test options that produce a listing file if 'binary' is not given.
  546:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_pp, ".P"),
  547:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_exp, ".E"),
  548:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_core0, ".core"),
  549:     ok = file:delete(filename:join(TargetDir, File ++ ".core")),
  550:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_core, ".core"),
  551:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_dis, ".dis"),
  552: 
  553:     %% Final clean up.
  554:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  555: 	filelib:wildcard(filename:join(TargetDir, "*"))),
  556:     ok = file:del_dir(TargetDir),
  557: 
  558:     do_file_listings(DataDir,PrivDir,Files).
  559: 
  560: listings_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  561:     {Big,Target} = get_files(Config, big, listings_big),
  562:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  563:     List = [{'S',".S"},
  564:             {'E',".E"},
  565:             {'P',".P"},
  566:             {dssa, ".ssa"},
  567:             {dssaopt, ".ssaopt"},
  568:             {dprecg, ".precodegen"},
  569:             {to_dis, ".dis"}],
  570:     p_listings(List, Big, TargetDir).
  571: 
  572: p_listings(List, File, BaseDir) ->
  573:     Run = fun({Option,Extension}) ->
  574:                   Uniq = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
  575:                   Dir = filename:join(BaseDir, integer_to_list(Uniq)),
  576:                   ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  577:                   try
  578:                       do_listing(File, Dir, Option, Extension),
  579:                       ok
  580:                   catch
  581:                       Class:Error:Stk ->
  582:                           io:format("~p:~p\n~p\n", [Class,Error,Stk]),
  583:                           error
  584:                   after
  585:                       _ = [ok = file:delete(F) ||
  586:                               F <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*"))],
  587:                       ok = file:del_dir(Dir)
  588:                   end
  589:           end,
  590:     test_lib:p_run(Run, List).
  591: 
  592: other_output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  593:     {Simple,_Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "other_output"),
  594: 
  595:     io:put_chars("to_pp"),
  596:     {ok,[],PP} = compile:file(Simple, [to_pp,binary,time]),
  597:     [] = [E || E <- PP,
  598: 	       begin
  599: 		   case element(1, E) of
  600: 		       attribute -> false;
  601: 		       function -> false;
  602: 		       eof -> false
  603: 		   end
  604: 	       end],
  605: 
  606:     io:put_chars("to_exp (file)"),
  607:     {ok,[],Expand} = compile:file(Simple, [to_exp,binary,time]),
  608:     true = is_list(Expand),
  609:     {attribute,_,module,simple} = lists:keyfind(module, 3, Expand),
  610:     io:put_chars("to_exp (forms)"),
  611:     {ok,[],Expand} = compile:forms(PP, [to_exp,binary,time]),
  612: 
  613:     io:put_chars("to_core (file)"),
  614:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:file(Simple, [to_core,binary,time]),
  615:     c_module = element(1, Core),
  616:     {ok,_} = core_lint:module(Core),
  617:     io:put_chars("to_core (forms)"),
  618:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:forms(PP, [to_core,binary,time]),
  619: 
  620:     io:put_chars("to_asm (file)"),
  621:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:file(Simple, [to_asm,binary,time]),
  622:     {simple,_,_,_,_} = Asm,
  623:     io:put_chars("to_asm (forms)"),
  624:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:forms(PP, [to_asm,binary,time]),
  625: 
  626:     ok.
  627: 
  628: encrypted_abstr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  629:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "encrypted_abstr"),
  630: 
  631:     Res = case has_crypto() of
  632: 	      false ->
  633: 		  %% No crypto.
  634: 		  encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target),
  635: 		  {comment,"The crypto application is missing or broken"};
  636: 	      true ->
  637: 		  %% Simulate not having crypto by removing
  638: 		  %% the crypto application from the path.
  639: 		  OldPath = code:get_path(),
  640: 		  try
  641: 		      NewPath = OldPath -- [filename:dirname(code:which(crypto))],
  642: 		      (catch crypto:stop()),
  643: 		      code:delete(crypto),
  644: 		      code:purge(crypto),
  645: 		      code:set_path(NewPath),
  646: 		      encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target)
  647: 		      after
  648: 			  code:set_path(OldPath)
  649: 		      end,
  650: 
  651: 		  %% Now run the tests that require crypto.
  652: 		  encrypted_abstr_1(Simple, Target),
  653: 		  ok = file:delete(Target),
  654: 		  _ = file:del_dir_r(filename:dirname(Target))
  655: 	  end,
  656:     
  657:     %% Cleanup.
  658:     Res.
  659: 
  660: encrypted_abstr_1(Simple, Target) ->
  661:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  662:     Key = "ablurf123BX#$;3",
  663:     install_crypto_key(Key),
  664:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  665: 				     [debug_info,{debug_info_key,Key},
  666: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  667:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  668: 
  669:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  670: 				     [{debug_info_key,Key},
  671: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  672:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  673: 
  674:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  675: 				     [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{des3_cbc,Key}},
  676: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  677:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  678: 
  679:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  680: 				     [{debug_info,{?MODULE,ok}},
  681: 				      {debug_info_key,Key},
  682: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  683:     verify_abstract(Target, ?MODULE),
  684: 
  685:     {ok,{simple,[{compile_info,CInfo}]}} =
  686: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [compile_info]),
  687:     {_,Opts} = lists:keyfind(options, 1, CInfo),
  688:     {_,'********'} = lists:keyfind(debug_info_key, 1, Opts),
  689: 
  690:     %% Try some illegal forms of crypto keys.
  691:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  692: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{blurf,"ss"}},report]),
  693:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  694: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{blurf,1,"ss"}},report]),
  695:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  696: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,42},report]),
  697: 
  698:     beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  699: 
  700:     %% Test to place the crypto file on disk. The test is dependent on the
  701:     %% $HOME of the emulator, so we do this test in another node.
  702:     TestHome = filename:join(TargetDir, "home"),
  703:     filelib:ensure_dir(TestHome),
  704:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  705:                   {win32, _} ->
  706:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  707:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  708:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  709:                   _ ->
  710:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  711:               end,
  712: 
  713:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
  714: 
  715:     erpc:call(
  716:       Node,
  717:       fun() ->
  718:               ok = file:set_cwd(TargetDir),
  719: 
  720:               error = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  721: 
  722:               CWDKey = "better use another key here",
  723:               CWDFile = ".erlang.crypt",
  724:               XDGKey = "better use yet another key here",
  725:               XDGFile = filename:join(
  726:                           filename:basedir(user_config,"erlang"),
  727:                           ".erlang.crypt"),
  728:               HOMEKey = "better use the home key here",
  729:               HOMEFile = filename:join(TestHome,".erlang.crypt"),
  730: 
  731:               write_crypt_file(CWDFile, CWDKey),
  732:               write_crypt_file(XDGFile, XDGKey),
  733:               write_crypt_file(HOMEFile, HOMEKey),
  734: 
  735:               %% First we test that .erlang.crypt in cwd works
  736:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  737:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  738:               ok = file:delete(CWDFile),
  739:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  740: 
  741:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in HOME does **not** work
  742:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  743:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code]),
  744: 
  745:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in HOME does work
  746:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  747:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  748:               ok = file:delete(HOMEFile),
  749:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  750: 
  751:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in XDG does **not** work
  752:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  753:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code]),
  754: 
  755: 
  756:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in XDG does work
  757:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  758:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  759:               ok = file:delete(XDGFile),
  760: 
  761:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  762:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  763:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code])
  764: 
  765:       end),
  766: 
  767:     peer:stop(Peer),
  768: 
  769:     %% Test key compatibility by reading a BEAM file produced before
  770:     %% the update to the new crypto functions.
  771:     install_crypto_key("an old key"),
  772:     KeyCompat = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple),
  773: 			      "key_compatibility"),
  774:     {ok,{key_compatibility,[Chunk]}} = beam_lib:chunks(KeyCompat,
  775: 						       [abstract_code]),
  776:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Chunk,
  777: 
  778:     ok.
  779: 
  780: write_crypt_file(File, Key) ->
  781:     Contents = ["[{debug_info,des3_cbc,simple,\"",Key,"\"}].\n"],
  782:     io:format("~s: ~s\n", [File, Contents]),
  783:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(File),
  784:     ok = file:write_file(File, Contents).
  785: 
  786: encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target) ->
  787:     io:format("simpe: ~p~n", [Simple]),
  788:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  789:     Key = "ablurf123BX#$;3",
  790:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  791: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,Key},
  792: 				{outdir,TargetDir},report]),
  793:     ok.
  794:     
  795: verify_abstract(Beam, Backend) ->
  796:     {ok,{simple,[Abst, Dbgi]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code, debug_info]),
  797:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Abst,
  798:     {debug_info,{debug_info_v1,Backend,_}} = Dbgi.
  799: 
  800: has_crypto() ->
  801:     try
  802: 	crypto:start(),
  803: 	crypto:stop(),
  804: 	true
  805:     catch
  806: 	error:_ -> false
  807:     end.
  808: 
  809: install_crypto_key(Key) ->
  810:     F = fun (init) -> ok;
  811: 	    ({debug_info,des3_cbc,_,_}) -> Key;
  812: 	    (clear) -> ok
  813: 	end,
  814:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(F).
  815: 
  816: %% Miscellaneous tests, mainly to get better coverage.
  817: debug_info(erlang_v1, Module, ok, _Opts) ->
  818:     {ok, [Module]};
  819: debug_info(erlang_v1, _Module, error, _Opts) ->
  820:     {error, unknown_format}.
  821: 
  822: custom_debug_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  823:     {Simple,_} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  824: 
  825:     {ok,simple,OkBin} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {debug_info,{?MODULE,ok}}]), %Coverage
  826:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,[simple]}}]}} =
  827: 	beam_lib:chunks(OkBin, [abstract_code]),
  828:     {ok,{simple,[{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,?MODULE,ok}}]}} =
  829: 	beam_lib:chunks(OkBin, [debug_info]),
  830: 
  831:     {ok,simple,ErrorBin} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {debug_info,{?MODULE,error}}]), %Coverage
  832:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,no_abstract_code}]}} =
  833: 	beam_lib:chunks(ErrorBin, [abstract_code]),
  834:     {ok,{simple,[{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,?MODULE,error}}]}} =
  835: 	beam_lib:chunks(ErrorBin, [debug_info]).
  836: 
  837: custom_compile_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  838:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  839:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,module,custom_compile_info}],
  840:     Opts = [binary,{compile_info,[{another,version}]}],
  841: 
  842:     {ok,custom_compile_info,Bin} = compile:forms(Forms, Opts),
  843:     {ok,{custom_compile_info,[{compile_info,CompileInfo}]}} =
  844: 	beam_lib:chunks(Bin, [compile_info]),
  845:     version = proplists:get_value(another, CompileInfo),
  846:     CompileOpts = proplists:get_value(options, CompileInfo),
  847:     undefined = proplists:get_value(compile_info, CompileOpts),
  848: 
  849:     {ok,custom_compile_info,DetBin} = compile:forms(Forms, [deterministic|Opts]),
  850:     {ok,{custom_compile_info,[{compile_info,DetInfo}]}} =
  851: 	beam_lib:chunks(DetBin, [compile_info]),
  852:     version = proplists:get_value(another, DetInfo).
  853: 
  854: cover(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  855:     io:format("~p\n", [compile:options()]),
  856:     ok.
  857: 
  858: do_listing(Source, TargetDir, Type, Ext) ->
  859:     io:format("Source: ~p TargetDir: ~p\n  Type: ~p Ext: ~p\n",
  860: 	      [Source, TargetDir, Type, Ext]),
  861:     case compile:file(Source, [Type, time, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  862: 	{ok, _} -> ok;
  863: 	Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other})
  864:     end,
  865:     SourceBase = filename:rootname(filename:basename(Source)),
  866: 
  867:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, SourceBase ++ Ext),
  868:     true = exists(Target).
  869: 
  870: get_files(Config, Module, OutputName) ->
  871:     code:delete(Module),
  872:     code:purge(Module),
  873:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  874:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  875:     Src = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module)),
  876:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, OutputName),
  877:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  878:     File = atom_to_list(Module) ++ code:objfile_extension(),
  879:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, File),
  880:     {Src, Target}.
  881: 
  882: run(Target, Func, Args) ->
  883:     Module = list_to_atom(filename:rootname(filename:basename(Target))),
  884:     {module, Module} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(Target)),
  885:     Result = (catch apply(Module, Func, Args)),
  886:     true = code:delete(Module),
  887:     false = code:purge(Module),
  888:     Result.
  889: 
  890: exists(Name) ->
  891:     case file:read_file_info(Name) of
  892: 	{ok, _}    -> true;
  893: 	{error, _} -> false
  894:     end.
  895: 
  896: 
  897: strict_record(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  898:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  899:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  900:     Opts = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors],
  901:     M = record_access,
  902:  
  903:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  904:     Turtle = test_strict(),
  905: 
  906:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [no_strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  907:     Turtle = test_sloppy(),
  908: 
  909:     %% The option first given wins.
  910:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [no_strict_record_tests,strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  911:     Turtle = test_sloppy(),
  912:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [strict_record_tests,no_strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  913:     Turtle = test_strict(),
  914: 
  915:     %% Default (possibly influenced by ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS).
  916:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [{outdir,Priv},report_errors]),
  917:     try
  918:         {1,2} = record_access:test(Turtle),
  919:         {comment,"Default: no_strict_record_tests"}
  920:     catch
  921:         error:{badrecord,Turtle} ->
  922:             {comment,"Default: strict_record_tests"}
  923:     end.
  924: 
  925: test_strict() ->
  926:     Turtle = record_access:turtle(),
  927:     try
  928:         record_access:test(Turtle)
  929:     catch
  930:         error:{badrecord,Turtle} ->
  931:             ok
  932:     end,
  933:     Turtle.
  934: 
  935: test_sloppy() ->
  936:     Turtle = record_access:turtle(),
  937:     {1,2} = record_access:test(Turtle),
  938:     Turtle.
  939: 
  940: utf8_atoms(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  941:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  942:     Atom = binary_to_atom(<<"こんにちは"/utf8>>, utf8),
  943:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,compile,[export_all]},
  944: 	     {function,Anno,atom,0,[{clause,Anno,[],[],[{atom,Anno,Atom}]}]}],
  945: 
  946:     Utf8AtomForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,utf8_atom}|Forms],
  947:     {ok,utf8_atom,Utf8AtomBin} =
  948: 	compile:forms(Utf8AtomForms, [binary]),
  949:     {ok,{utf8_atom,[{atoms,_}]}} =
  950: 	beam_lib:chunks(Utf8AtomBin, [atoms]),
  951:     code:load_binary(utf8_atom, "compile_SUITE", Utf8AtomBin),
  952:     Atom = utf8_atom:atom(),
  953:     true = is_atom(Atom),
  954:     ok.
  955: 
  956: utf8_functions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  957:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  958:     Atom = binary_to_atom(<<"こんにちは"/utf8>>, utf8),
  959:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,compile,[export_all]},
  960: 	     {function,Anno,Atom,0,[{clause,Anno,[],[],[{atom,Anno,world}]}]}],
  961: 
  962:     Utf8FunctionForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,utf8_function}|Forms],
  963:     {ok,utf8_function,Utf8FunctionBin} =
  964: 	compile:forms(Utf8FunctionForms, [binary]),
  965:     {ok,{utf8_function,[{atoms,_}]}} =
  966: 	beam_lib:chunks(Utf8FunctionBin, [atoms]),
  967:     code:load_binary(utf8_function, "compile_SUITE", Utf8FunctionBin),
  968:     world = utf8_function:Atom(),
  969: 
  970:     NoUtf8FunctionForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,no_utf8_function}|Forms],
  971:     error = compile:forms(NoUtf8FunctionForms, [binary, r19]).
  972: 
  973: extra_chunks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  974:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  975:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,module,extra_chunks}],
  976: 
  977:     {ok,extra_chunks,ExtraChunksBinary} =
  978: 	compile:forms(Forms, [binary, {extra_chunks, [{<<"ExCh">>, <<"Contents">>}]}]),
  979:     {ok,{extra_chunks,[{"ExCh",<<"Contents">>}]}} =
  980: 	beam_lib:chunks(ExtraChunksBinary, ["ExCh"]).
  981: 
  982: tuple_calls(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  983:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  984:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,export,[{size,1},{store,1}]},
  985: 	     {function,Anno,size,1,
  986: 	      [{clause,Anno,[{var,Anno,mod}],[],
  987: 	       [{call,Anno,{remote,Anno,{var,Anno,mod},{atom,Anno,size}},
  988:                  []}]}]},
  989: 	     {function,Anno,store,1,
  990: 	      [{clause,Anno,[{var,Anno,mod}],[],
  991: 	       [{call,Anno,{remote,Anno,{var,Anno,mod},{atom,Anno,store}},
  992:                  [{atom,Anno,key},{atom,Anno,value}]}]}]}],
  993: 
  994:     TupleCallsFalse = [{attribute,Anno,module,tuple_calls_false}|Forms],
  995:     {ok,_,TupleCallsFalseBinary} = compile:forms(TupleCallsFalse, [binary]),
  996:     code:load_binary(tuple_calls_false, "compile_SUITE.erl", TupleCallsFalseBinary),
  997:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:store(dict())),
  998:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:size(dict())),
  999:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:size(empty_tuple())),
 1000: 
 1001:     TupleCallsTrue = [{attribute,Anno,module,tuple_calls_true}|Forms],
 1002:     {ok,_,TupleCallsTrueBinary} = compile:forms(TupleCallsTrue, [binary,tuple_calls]),
 1003:     code:load_binary(tuple_calls_true, "compile_SUITE.erl", TupleCallsTrueBinary),
 1004:     Dict = tuple_calls_true:store(dict()),
 1005:     1 = tuple_calls_true:size(Dict),
 1006:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_true:size(empty_tuple())),
 1007: 
 1008:     ok.
 1009: 
 1010: dict() ->
 1011:     dict:new().
 1012: empty_tuple() ->
 1013:     {}.
 1014: 
 1015: env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1016:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, env),
 1017:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1018:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:dirname(Target)),
 1019: 
 1020:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "binary"),
 1021:     try
 1022: 	env_1(Simple, Target)
 1023:     after
 1024: 	true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "ignore_me"),
 1025: 	file:set_cwd(Cwd),
 1026: 	file:delete(Target),
 1027: 	file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target))
 1028:     end,
 1029:     ok.
 1030: 
 1031: env_1(Simple, Target) ->
 1032:     %% file
 1033:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:file(Simple),
 1034:     {ok,simple} = compile:noenv_file(Simple, [debug_info]),
 1035:     {ok,simple} = compile:noenv_file(Simple, debug_info),
 1036: 
 1037:     true = exists(Target),
 1038:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,Abstr0}]}} =
 1039: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [abstract_code]),
 1040:     {raw_abstract_v1,Forms} = Abstr0,
 1041: 
 1042:     %% forms
 1043:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strong_validation"),
 1044:     {ok,simple} = compile:forms(Forms),
 1045:     {ok,simple,<<"FOR1",_/binary>>} = compile:noenv_forms(Forms, []),
 1046: 
 1047:     %% output_generated
 1048:     false = compile:output_generated([]),
 1049:     true = compile:noenv_output_generated([]),
 1050: 
 1051:     ok = file:delete(Target),
 1052: 
 1053:     %% Cover error handling.
 1054:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "'unterminated_atom"),
 1055:     {ok,[]} = compile:forms(Forms, [basic_validation]),
 1056:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", ",,,"),
 1057:     {ok,[]} = compile:forms(Forms, [basic_validation]),
 1058:     {ok,simple,<<"FOR1",_/binary>>} = compile:noenv_forms(Forms, no_postopt),
 1059: 
 1060:     ok.
 1061: 
 1062: %% Test pretty-printing in Core Erlang format and then try to
 1063: %% compile the generated Core Erlang files.
 1064: 
 1065: core_pp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1066:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1067:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1068:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1069: 
 1070:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1071:     Abstr = [begin {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,
 1072: 				    {raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} = 
 1073: 			     beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1074: 			 {Mod,Abstr} end || Beam <- TestBeams],
 1075:     test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_core_pp(F, Outdir) end, Abstr).
 1076:     
 1077: do_core_pp({M,A}, Outdir) ->
 1078:     try
 1079: 	do_core_pp_1(M, A, Outdir)
 1080:     catch
 1081: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1082: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for module ~s\n",
 1083: 		      [Error,M]),
 1084: 	    error;
 1085: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1086: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1087: 	    error
 1088:     end.
 1089: 
 1090: do_core_pp_1(M, A, Outdir) ->
 1091:     {ok,M,Core0} = compile:forms(A, [to_core]),
 1092:     CoreFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".core"),
 1093:     CorePP = core_pp:format(Core0),
 1094:     ok = file:write_file(CoreFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(CorePP)),
 1095: 
 1096:     %% Parse the .core file and return the result as Core Erlang Terms.
 1097:     Core = case compile:file(CoreFile, [report_errors,from_core,no_copt,to_core,binary]) of
 1098: 	       {ok,M,Core1} -> Core1;
 1099: 	       Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1100: 	   end,
 1101:     ok = file:delete(CoreFile),
 1102: 
 1103:     %% Compile as usual (including optimizations).
 1104:     compile_forms(M, Core, [clint,ssalint,from_core,binary]),
 1105: 
 1106:     %% Don't optimize to test that we are not dependent
 1107:     %% on the Core Erlang optimization passes.
 1108:     %% (Example of a previous bug: The core_parse pass
 1109:     %% would not turn map literals into #c_literal{}
 1110:     %% records; if sys_core_fold was run it would fix
 1111:     %% that; if sys_core_fold was not run v3_kernel would
 1112:     %% crash.)
 1113:     compile_forms(M, Core, [clint,ssalint,from_core,no_copt,binary]),
 1114: 
 1115:     ok.
 1116: 
 1117: compile_forms(Mod, Forms, Opts) ->
 1118:     case compile:forms(Forms, [report_errors|Opts]) of
 1119: 	{ok,Mod,_} ->  ok;
 1120: 	Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1121:     end.
 1122: 
 1123: %% Pretty-print core and read it back. Should be identical.
 1124: 
 1125: core_roundtrip(Config) ->
 1126:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1127:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1128:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1129: 
 1130:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1131: 
 1132:     Test = fun(F) -> do_core_roundtrip(F, Outdir) end,
 1133:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 1134:         4 ->
 1135:             %% This test case is very memory intensive. Only
 1136:             %% use a single process.
 1137:             test_lib:p_run(Test, TestBeams, 1);
 1138:         8 ->
 1139:             test_lib:p_run(Test, TestBeams)
 1140:     end.
 1141: 
 1142: do_core_roundtrip(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1143:     try
 1144: 	{ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1145: 	    beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1146: 	do_core_roundtrip_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir)
 1147:     catch
 1148: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1149: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for file ~s\n",
 1150: 		      [Error,Beam]),
 1151: 	    error;
 1152: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1153: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [Beam,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1154: 	    error
 1155:     end.
 1156: 
 1157: do_core_roundtrip_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir) ->
 1158:     {ok,Mod,Core0} = compile:forms(Abstr, [to_core0]),
 1159:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core0, Outdir),
 1160: 
 1161:     %% Primarily, test that annotations are accepted for all
 1162:     %% constructs. Secondarily, smoke test cerl_trees:label/1.
 1163:     {Core1,_} = cerl_trees:label(Core0),
 1164:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core1, Outdir),
 1165: 
 1166:     %% Run the inliner to force generation of variables
 1167:     %% with numeric names.
 1168:     {ok,Mod,Core2} = compile:forms(Abstr, [inline,to_core]),
 1169:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core2, Outdir).
 1170: 
 1171: do_core_roundtrip_2(M, Core0, Outdir) ->
 1172:     CoreFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".core"),
 1173:     CorePP = core_pp:format_all(Core0),
 1174:     ok = file:write_file(CoreFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(CorePP)),
 1175: 
 1176:     %% Parse the .core file and return the result as Core Erlang Terms.
 1177:     Core2 = case compile:file(CoreFile, [report_errors,from_core,
 1178: 					 no_copt,to_core,binary]) of
 1179: 		{ok,M,Core1} -> Core1;
 1180: 		Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1181: 	    end,
 1182:     Core = undo_var_translation(Core2),
 1183:     ok = file:delete(CoreFile),
 1184: 
 1185:     case cmp_core(Core0, Core, M) of
 1186: 	true -> ok;
 1187: 	false -> error
 1188:     end.
 1189: 
 1190: undo_var_translation(Tree) ->
 1191:     F = fun(Node) ->
 1192: 		case cerl:is_c_var(Node) of
 1193: 		    true ->
 1194: 			Name0 = cerl:var_name(Node),
 1195: 			try atom_to_list(Name0) of
 1196: 			    "_X"++Name ->
 1197: 				cerl:update_c_var(Node, list_to_atom(Name));
 1198: 			    "_"++Name ->
 1199: 				cerl:update_c_var(Node, list_to_atom(Name));
 1200: 			    _ ->
 1201: 				Node
 1202: 			catch
 1203: 			    error:badarg ->
 1204: 				Node
 1205: 
 1206: 			end;
 1207: 		    false ->
 1208: 			Node
 1209: 		end
 1210: 	end,
 1211:     cerl_trees:map(F, Tree).
 1212: 
 1213: cmp_core(E, E, _Mod) ->
 1214:     true;
 1215: cmp_core(M1, M2, Mod) ->
 1216:     cmp_core_fs(cerl:module_defs(M1), cerl:module_defs(M2), Mod).
 1217: 
 1218: cmp_core_fs([F1|T1], [F2|T2], Mod) ->
 1219:     cmp_core_f(F1, F2, Mod) andalso cmp_core_fs(T1, T2, Mod);
 1220: cmp_core_fs([], [], _Mod) ->
 1221:     true;
 1222: cmp_core_fs(_, _, _Mod) ->
 1223:     false.
 1224: 
 1225: cmp_core_f(E, E, _Mod) ->
 1226:     true;
 1227: cmp_core_f({Name,F1}, {Name,F2}, Mod) ->
 1228:     case diff(F1, F2) of
 1229: 	F1 ->
 1230: 	    true;
 1231: 	Diff ->
 1232: 	    io:format("~p ~p:\n~p\n", [Mod,Name,Diff]),
 1233: 	    false
 1234:     end.
 1235: 
 1236: diff(E, E) ->
 1237:     E;
 1238: diff([H1|T1], [H2|T2]) ->
 1239:     [diff(H1, H2)|diff(T1, T2)];
 1240: diff(T1, T2) when tuple_size(T1) =:= tuple_size(T2) ->
 1241:     case cerl:is_c_var(T1) andalso cerl:is_c_var(T2) of
 1242:         true ->
 1243:             diff_var(T1, T2);
 1244:         false ->
 1245:             case cerl:is_c_map(T1) andalso cerl:is_c_map(T2) of
 1246:                 true ->
 1247:                     diff_map(T1, T2);
 1248:                 false ->
 1249:                     diff_tuple(T1, T2)
 1250:             end
 1251:     end;
 1252: diff(E1, E2) ->
 1253:     {'DIFF',E1,E2}.
 1254: 
 1255: diff_var(V1, V2) ->
 1256:     case {cerl:var_name(V1),cerl:var_name(V2)} of
 1257:         {Same,Same} ->
 1258:             V1;
 1259:         {Name1,Name2} ->
 1260:             %% The inliner uses integers as variable names. Such integers
 1261:             %% are read back as atoms.
 1262:             case is_integer(Name1) andalso
 1263:                 list_to_atom(integer_to_list(Name1)) =:= Name2 of
 1264:                 true ->
 1265:                     V1;
 1266:                 _ ->
 1267:                     cerl:update_c_var(V1, {'DIFF',Name1,Name2})
 1268:             end
 1269:     end.
 1270: 
 1271: %% Annotations for maps are not preserved exactly, but that is not
 1272: %% a real problem. Workaround by not comparing all annotations when
 1273: %% comparing maps.
 1274: 
 1275: diff_map(M, M) ->
 1276:     M;
 1277: diff_map(M1, M2) ->
 1278:     case cerl:get_ann(M1) =:= cerl:get_ann(M2) of
 1279:         false ->
 1280:             diff_tuple(M1, M2);
 1281:         true ->
 1282:             case remove_compiler_gen(M1) =:= remove_compiler_gen(M2) of
 1283:                 true ->
 1284:                     M1;
 1285:                 false ->
 1286:                     diff_tuple(M1, M2)
 1287:             end
 1288:     end.
 1289: 
 1290: diff_tuple(T1, T2) ->
 1291:     L = diff(tuple_to_list(T1), tuple_to_list(T2)),
 1292:     list_to_tuple(L).
 1293: 
 1294: remove_compiler_gen(M) ->
 1295:     Arg0 = cerl:map_arg(M),
 1296:     Arg = cerl:set_ann(Arg0, []),
 1297:     Es0 = cerl:map_es(M),
 1298:     Es = [remove_compiler_gen_1(Pair) || Pair <- Es0],
 1299:     cerl:update_c_map(M, Arg, Es).
 1300: 
 1301: remove_compiler_gen_1(Pair) ->
 1302:     Op0 = cerl:map_pair_op(Pair),
 1303:     Op = cerl:set_ann(Op0, []),
 1304:     K = map_var(cerl:map_pair_key(Pair)),
 1305:     V = map_var(cerl:map_pair_val(Pair)),
 1306:     cerl:update_c_map_pair(Pair, Op, K, V).
 1307: 
 1308: map_var(Var) ->
 1309:     case cerl:is_c_var(Var) of
 1310:         true ->
 1311:             case cerl:var_name(Var) of
 1312:                 Name when is_atom(Name) ->
 1313:                     L = atom_to_list(Name),
 1314:                     try list_to_integer(L) of
 1315:                         Int ->
 1316:                             cerl:update_c_var(Var, Int)
 1317:                     catch
 1318:                         error:_ ->
 1319:                             Var
 1320:                     end;
 1321:                 _ ->
 1322:                     Var
 1323:             end;
 1324:         false ->
 1325:             Var
 1326:     end.
 1327: 
 1328: %% Compile to Beam assembly language (.S) and then try to
 1329: %% run .S through the compiler again.
 1330: 
 1331: asm(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1332:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1333:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "asm"),
 1334:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1335: 
 1336:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1337:     Res = test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_asm(F, Outdir) end, TestBeams),
 1338:     Res.
 1339: 
 1340:     
 1341: do_asm(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1342:     {ok,{M,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,A}}]}} =
 1343: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1344:     try
 1345:         Opts = test_lib:opt_opts(M),
 1346: 	{ok,M,Asm} = compile:forms(A, ['S'|Opts]),
 1347: 	AsmFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".S"),
 1348: 	{ok,Fd} = file:open(AsmFile, [write,{encoding,utf8}]),
 1349: 	beam_listing:module(Fd, Asm),
 1350: 	ok = file:close(Fd),
 1351:         case compile:file(AsmFile, [from_asm,binary,report|Opts]) of
 1352: 	    {ok,M,_} ->
 1353: 		ok = file:delete(AsmFile);
 1354: 	    Other ->
 1355: 		io:format("*** failure '~p' for ~s\n",
 1356: 			  [Other,AsmFile]),
 1357: 		error
 1358: 	end
 1359:     catch Class:Error:Stk ->
 1360: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1361: 	    error
 1362:     end.
 1363: 
 1364: %% Compile a crafted file which produces the three call instructions
 1365: %% which should have a comment with the called function in clear
 1366: %% text. We check that the expected functions and comments occur in
 1367: %% the listing.
 1368: 
 1369: asm_labels(Config) ->
 1370:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1371:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1372:     InFile = filename:join(DataDir, "asm_labels.erl"),
 1373:     OutDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "asm_labels"),
 1374:     OutFile = filename:join(OutDir, "asm_labels.S"),
 1375:     ok = file:make_dir(OutDir),
 1376:     {ok,asm_labels} = compile:file(InFile, ['S',{outdir,OutDir}]),
 1377:     {ok,Listing} = file:read_file(OutFile),
 1378:     Os = [global,multiline,{capture,all_but_first,list}],
 1379:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call,.+,{f,.+}}\\. % foo/1)", Os),
 1380:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call_only,.+,{f,.+}}\\. % foo/1)", Os),
 1381:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call_last,.+,{f,.+},.+}\\. % bar/1)", Os),
 1382:     ok = file:del_dir_r(OutDir).
 1383: 
 1384: sys_pre_attributes(Config) ->
 1385:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1386:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "attributes.erl"),
 1387:     Mod = attributes,
 1388:     CommonOpts = [binary,report,verbose,
 1389: 		  {parse_transform,sys_pre_attributes}],
 1390:     PreOpts = [{attribute,delete,deleted}],
 1391:     PostOpts = [{attribute,insert,inserted,"value"}],
 1392:     PrePostOpts = [{attribute,replace,replaced,42},
 1393: 		   {attribute,replace,replace_nonexisting,new}],
 1394:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(File, PrePostOpts ++ PreOpts ++
 1395: 				     PostOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1396:     code:load_binary(Mod, File, Code),
 1397:     Attr = Mod:module_info(attributes),
 1398:     io:format("~p", [Attr]),
 1399:     {inserted,"value"} = lists:keyfind(inserted, 1, Attr),
 1400:     {replaced,[42]} = lists:keyfind(replaced, 1, Attr),
 1401:     {replace_nonexisting,[new]} = lists:keyfind(replace_nonexisting, 1, Attr),
 1402:     false = lists:keymember(deleted, 1, Attr),
 1403: 
 1404:     %% Cover more code.
 1405:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PostOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1406:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, CommonOpts -- [verbose]),
 1407:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PreOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1408:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File,
 1409: 			      [{attribute,replace,replaced,42}|CommonOpts]),
 1410:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PrePostOpts ++ PreOpts ++
 1411: 				  PostOpts ++ CommonOpts --
 1412: 				  [report,verbose]),
 1413:     ok.
 1414: 
 1415: %% Test the dialyzer option to cover more code.
 1416: dialyzer(Config) ->
 1417:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1418:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
 1419:     Opts = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors],
 1420:     M = dialyzer_test,
 1421:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [dialyzer|Opts]),
 1422:     [{a,b,c}] = M:M(),
 1423: 
 1424:     %% Cover huge line numbers without the 'dialyzer' option.
 1425:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, Opts),
 1426:     [{a,b,c}] = M:M(),
 1427:     ok.
 1428: 
 1429: 
 1430: %% Test that warnings contain filenames and line numbers.
 1431: warnings(_Config) ->
 1432:     Files = get_unique_files(".erl"),
 1433:     test_lib:p_run(fun do_warnings/1, Files).
 1434: 
 1435: do_warnings(F) ->
 1436:     Options = [{feature,maybe_expr,enable},binary,bin_opt_info,recv_opt_info,return],
 1437:     {ok,_,_,Ws} = compile:file(F, Options),
 1438:     do_warnings_1(Ws, F).
 1439: 
 1440: do_warnings_1([{"no_file",Ws}|_], F) ->
 1441:     io:format("~s:\nMissing file for warnings: ~p\n",
 1442: 	      [F,Ws]),
 1443:     error;
 1444: do_warnings_1([{Name,Ws}|T], F) ->
 1445:     case filename:extension(Name) of
 1446: 	".erl" ->
 1447: 	    do_warnings_2(Ws, T, F);
 1448: 	_ ->
 1449: 	    io:format("~s:\nNo .erl extension\n", [F]),
 1450: 	    error
 1451:     end;
 1452: do_warnings_1([], _) -> ok.
 1453: 
 1454: do_warnings_2([{Pos,_,_}=W|T], Next, F) ->
 1455:     case Pos of
 1456: 	Line when is_integer(Line) ->
 1457: 	    do_warnings_2(T, Next, F);
 1458: 	{Line,Col} when is_integer(Line), is_integer(Col) ->
 1459: 	    do_warnings_2(T, Next, F);
 1460: 	true ->
 1461: 	    io:format("~s:\nMissing line number: ~p\n",
 1462: 		      [F,W]),
 1463: 	    error
 1464:     end;
 1465: do_warnings_2([], Next, F) ->
 1466:     do_warnings_1(Next, F).
 1467: 
 1468: message_printing(Config) ->
 1469:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1470:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1471: 
 1472:     BadEncFile = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_enc.erl"),
 1473:     {error,BadEncErrors, []} = compile:file(BadEncFile, [return]),
 1474: 
 1475:     [":7:15: cannot parse file, giving up\n"
 1476:      "%    7| \t    {ok, \"xyz\n"
 1477:      "%     | \t             ^\n\n"
 1478:     ,
 1479:      ":7:15: cannot translate from UTF-8\n"
 1480:      "%    7| \t    {ok, \"xyz\n"
 1481:      "%     | \t             ^\n\n"
 1482:     ] = messages(BadEncErrors),
 1483: 
 1484:     UTF8File = filename:join(DataDir, "col_utf8.erl"),
 1485:     {ok,_,UTF8Errors} = compile:file(UTF8File, [return]),
 1486:     [":5:23: a term is constructed, but never used\n"
 1487:      "%    5|     B = <<\"xyzåäö\">>,\t<<\"12345\">>,\n"
 1488:      "%     |                      \t^\n\n"
 1489:     ] = messages(UTF8Errors),
 1490: 
 1491:     Latin1File = filename:join(DataDir, "col_lat1.erl"),
 1492:     {ok,_,Latin1Errors} = compile:file(Latin1File, [return]),
 1493:     [":6:23: a term is constructed, but never used\n"
 1494:      "%    6|     B = <<\"xyzåäö\">>,\t<<\"12345\">>,\n"
 1495:      "%     |                      \t^\n\n"
 1496:     ] = messages(Latin1Errors),
 1497: 
 1498:     LongFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "long.erl"),
 1499:     Long = ["-module(long).\n",
 1500:             "-export([foo/0]).\n",
 1501:             "unused() -> ok.\n",
 1502:             lists:duplicate(10000, $\n),
 1503:             "foo() -> bar().\n"],
 1504:     ok = file:write_file(LongFile, Long),
 1505:     {error,LongErrors,LongWarnings} = compile:file(LongFile, [return]),
 1506:     [":10004:10: function bar/0 undefined\n"
 1507:      "% 10004| foo() -> bar().\n"
 1508:      "%      |          ^\n\n"
 1509:     ] = messages(LongErrors),
 1510:     [":3:1: function unused/0 is unused\n"
 1511:      "%    3| unused() -> ok.\n"
 1512:      "%     | ^\n\n"
 1513:     ] = messages(LongWarnings),
 1514:     ok = file:delete(LongFile),
 1515: 
 1516:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1517:     try
 1518:         ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
 1519:         {ok,cover_messages,_} = compile:file(cover_messages, [report, binary])
 1520:     after
 1521:         file:set_cwd(OldCwd)
 1522:     end,
 1523: 
 1524:     ok.
 1525: 
 1526: messages(Errors) ->
 1527:     lists:flatmap(fun ({{File,_L},Descs}) -> format_descs(File, Descs);
 1528:                       ({File,Descs}) -> format_descs(File, Descs)
 1529:                   end,
 1530:                   Errors).
 1531: 
 1532: format_descs(File, Descs) ->
 1533:     [strip_prefix(File, lists:flatten(Text))
 1534:      || {_Where, Text} <- sys_messages:format_messages(File, "", Descs, [])].
 1535: 
 1536: strip_prefix(Prefix, String) ->
 1537:     case string:prefix(String, Prefix) of
 1538:         nomatch -> String;
 1539:         Rest -> Rest
 1540:     end.
 1541: 
 1542: %% Test that the compile:pre_load/0 function (used by 'erlc')
 1543: %% pre-loads the modules that are used by a typical compilation.
 1544: 
 1545: pre_load_check(Config) ->
 1546:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1547:         true ->
 1548:             {skip,"Cover is running"};
 1549:         false ->
 1550:             try
 1551:                 do_pre_load_check(Config)
 1552:             after
 1553:                 dbg:stop()
 1554:             end
 1555:     end.
 1556: 
 1557: do_pre_load_check(Config) ->
 1558:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
 1559:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple.erl"),
 1560:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big.erl"),
 1561:     {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(process, {fun pre_load_trace/2,[]}),
 1562:     dbg:p(self(), call),
 1563:     dbg:p(new, call),
 1564:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl({?MODULE,get_trace_data,0}, []),
 1565:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp({code,ensure_modules_loaded,1}, []),
 1566: 
 1567:     %% Compile a simple module using the erl_compile interface
 1568:     %% to find out the modules that are pre-loaded by
 1569:     %% compile:pre_load/0.
 1570:     Opts = #options{specific=[binary]},
 1571:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:compile(Simple, "", Opts),
 1572:     [{code,ensure_modules_loaded,[PreLoaded0]}] = get_trace_data(),
 1573:     PreLoaded1 = ordsets:from_list(PreLoaded0),
 1574: 
 1575:     %% Since 'compile' is the function doing the pre-loaded,
 1576:     %% it is useless to include it in the list.
 1577:     case ordsets:is_element(compile, PreLoaded1) of
 1578: 	true ->
 1579: 	    io:put_chars("The 'compile' module should not be included "
 1580: 			 "in the list of modules to be pre-loaded."),
 1581: 	    ct:fail(compile);
 1582: 	false ->
 1583: 	    []
 1584:     end,
 1585:     PreLoaded = ordsets:add_element(compile, PreLoaded1),
 1586: 
 1587:     %% Now unload all pre-loaded modules and all modules in
 1588:     %% compiler application. Then compile a module to find
 1589:     %% which modules that get loaded.
 1590:     CompilerMods = compiler_modules(),
 1591:     Unload = ordsets:union(ordsets:from_list(CompilerMods), PreLoaded),
 1592:     _ = [begin
 1593: 	     code:delete(M),
 1594: 	     code:purge(M)
 1595: 	 end || M <- Unload],
 1596: 
 1597:     {ok,_} = dbg:ctp({code,ensure_modules_loaded,1}),
 1598:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp({code,ensure_loaded,1}, []),
 1599:     {ok,big,_} = compile:file(Big, [binary]),
 1600:     WasLoaded0 = get_trace_data(),
 1601:     WasLoaded1 = [M || {code,ensure_loaded,[M]} <- WasLoaded0],
 1602:     WasLoaded = ordsets:from_list(WasLoaded1),
 1603: 
 1604:     %% Check for modules that should have been pre-loaded.
 1605:     case ordsets:subtract(WasLoaded, PreLoaded) of
 1606: 	[] ->
 1607: 	    ok;
 1608: 	[_|_]=NotPreLoaded ->
 1609: 	    io:format("The following modules were used "
 1610: 		      "but not pre-loaded:\n~p\n",
 1611: 		      [NotPreLoaded]),
 1612: 	    ct:fail({not_preload,NotPreLoaded})
 1613:     end,
 1614: 
 1615:     %% Check for modules that should not be pre-loaded.
 1616:     case ordsets:subtract(PreLoaded, WasLoaded) of
 1617: 	[] ->
 1618: 	    ok;
 1619: 	[_|_]=NotUsed ->
 1620: 	    io:format("The following modules were pre-loaded"
 1621: 		      " but not used:\n~p\n",
 1622: 		      [NotUsed]),
 1623: 	    ct:fail({not_used,NotUsed})
 1624:     end,
 1625: 
 1626:     ok.
 1627: 
 1628: get_trace_data() ->
 1629:     %% Apparantely, doing a receive at the beginning of
 1630:     %% a traced function can cause extra trace messages.
 1631:     %% To avoid that, don't do the receive in this function.
 1632:     do_get_trace_data().
 1633: 
 1634: do_get_trace_data() ->
 1635:     receive
 1636: 	{trace_data,Data} -> Data
 1637:     end.
 1638: 
 1639: pre_load_trace({trace,Pid,call,{?MODULE,get_trace_data,[]}}, Acc) ->
 1640:     Pid ! {trace_data,Acc},
 1641:     [];
 1642: pre_load_trace({trace,_,call,MFA}, Acc) ->
 1643:     [MFA|Acc].
 1644: 
 1645: compiler_modules() ->
 1646:     Wc = filename:join([code:lib_dir(compiler),"ebin","*.beam"]),
 1647:     Ms = filelib:wildcard(Wc),
 1648:     FN = filename,
 1649:     [list_to_atom(FN:rootname(FN:basename(M), ".beam")) || M <- Ms].
 1650: 
 1651: %% Test that ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS are correctly retrieved
 1652: %% by env_compiler_options/0
 1653: 
 1654: env_compiler_options(_Config) ->
 1655:     Cases = [
 1656:         {"bin_opt_info", [bin_opt_info]},
 1657:         {"recv_opt_info", [recv_opt_info]},
 1658:         {"'S'", ['S']},
 1659:         {"{source, \"test.erl\"}", [{source, "test.erl"}]},
 1660:         {"[{d,macro_one,1},{d,macro_two}]", [{d, macro_one, 1}, {d, macro_two}]},
 1661:         {"[warn_export_all, warn_export_vars]", [warn_export_all, warn_export_vars]}
 1662:     ],
 1663:     F = fun({Env, Expected}) ->
 1664:         true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", Env),
 1665:         Expected = compile:env_compiler_options()
 1666:     end,
 1667:     lists:foreach(F, Cases).
 1668: 
 1669: %% Test options for compatibility with previous major versions of OTP.
 1670: 
 1671: bc_options(Config) ->
 1672:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1673: 
 1674:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1675: 
 1676:     L = [{171, small_float, [no_line_info,
 1677:                              no_ssa_opt_float,
 1678:                              no_type_opt]},
 1679:          {171, small_float, [no_line_info]},
 1680:          {171, small_float, []},
 1681:          {171, small_float, [r24]},
 1682:          {171, small_float, [r25]},
 1683: 
 1684:          {172, small, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1685:                        no_ssa_opt_float,
 1686:                        no_line_info,
 1687:                        no_type_opt,
 1688:                        no_bs_match]},
 1689:          {172, small, [r24]},
 1690: 
 1691:          {172, funs, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1692:                       no_ssa_opt_float,no_line_info,
 1693:                       no_type_opt]},
 1694:          {172, funs, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1695:                       no_line_info,
 1696:                       no_stack_trimming,
 1697:                       no_type_opt]},
 1698:          {172, funs, [r24]},
 1699: 
 1700:          {172, small_maps, [r24]},
 1701:          {172, small_maps, [no_type_opt]},
 1702: 
 1703:          {172, big, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1704:                      no_ssa_opt_float,
 1705:                      no_line_info,
 1706:                      no_type_opt]},
 1707:          {172, big, [r24]},
 1708: 
 1709:          {178, small, [r25]},
 1710:          {178, big, [r25]},
 1711:          {178, funs, []},
 1712:          {178, big, []}
 1713:         ],
 1714: 
 1715:     Test = fun({Expected,Mod,Options}) ->
 1716:                    case highest_opcode(DataDir, Mod, Options) of
 1717:                        Expected ->
 1718:                            ok;
 1719:                        Got ->
 1720:                            io:format("*** module ~p, options ~p => got ~p; expected ~p\n",
 1721:                                      [Mod,Options,Got,Expected]),
 1722:                            error
 1723:                    end
 1724:            end,
 1725:     test_lib:p_run(Test, L),
 1726:     ok.
 1727: 
 1728: highest_opcode(DataDir, Mod, Opt) ->
 1729:     Src = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Mod)++".erl"),
 1730:     {ok,Mod,Beam} = compile:file(Src, [binary,report_errors|Opt]),
 1731:     test_lib:highest_opcode(Beam).
 1732: 
 1733: deterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1734:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1735:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
 1736:  
 1737:     %% Files without +deterministic should differ if their include paths do,
 1738:     %% as their debug info will be different.
 1739:     {ok,_,NonDetA} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {i,"gurka"}]),
 1740:     {ok,_,NonDetB} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {i,"gaffel"}]),
 1741:     true = NonDetA =/= NonDetB,
 1742: 
 1743:     %% ... but files with +deterministic shouldn't.
 1744:     {ok,_,DetC} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, deterministic, {i,"gurka"}]),
 1745:     {ok,_,DetD} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, deterministic, {i,"gaffel"}]),
 1746:     true = DetC =:= DetD,
 1747: 
 1748:     ok.
 1749: 
 1750: deterministic_paths(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1751:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1752: 
 1753:     %% Files without +deterministic should differ if they were compiled from a
 1754:     %% different directory.
 1755:     true = deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, "simple", []),
 1756: 
 1757:     %% ... but files with +deterministic shouldn't.
 1758:     false = deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, "simple", [deterministic]),
 1759: 
 1760:     ok.
 1761: 
 1762: deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, Name, Opts) ->
 1763:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
 1764:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1765:     try
 1766:         {ok,_,A} = compile:file(Simple, [binary | Opts]),
 1767:         ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
 1768:         {ok,_,B} = compile:file(Name, [binary | Opts]),
 1769:         A =/= B
 1770:     after
 1771:         file:set_cwd(Cwd)
 1772:     end.
 1773: 
 1774: %% ERL-1058: -compile(debug_info) had no effect
 1775: compile_attribute(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1776:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1777: 
 1778:     %% The test module has a -compile([debug_info]). attribute, which means
 1779:     %% debug information should always be included.
 1780:     debug_info_attribute(DataDir, "debug_info", [debug_info]),
 1781:     debug_info_attribute(DataDir, "debug_info", []),
 1782: 
 1783:     ok.
 1784: 
 1785: debug_info_attribute(DataDir, Name, Opts) ->
 1786:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
 1787:     {ok,_,Bin} = compile:file(File, [binary | Opts]),
 1788:     {ok, {_, Attrs}} = beam_lib:chunks(Bin, [debug_info]),
 1789: 
 1790:     [{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,erl_abstract_code, {Forms, _}}}] = Attrs,
 1791:     [{attribute,{1,1},file,{_,1}},
 1792:      {attribute,{1,2},module,debug_info},
 1793:      {attribute,{2,2},compile,[debug_info]},
 1794:      {eof,_}] = forms_to_terms(Forms),
 1795: 
 1796:     ok.
 1797: 
 1798: forms_to_terms(Forms) ->
 1799:     [erl_parse:anno_to_term(Form) || Form <- Forms].
 1800: 
 1801: %% Test compiler options not tested in other test cases.
 1802: other_options(Config) ->
 1803:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1804: 
 1805:     %% Smoke test of no_spawn_compiler_process, brief, and absolute_source
 1806:     %% options.
 1807:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big"),
 1808:     {ok,big,<<_/binary>>} =
 1809:         compile:file(Big, [binary,
 1810:                            no_spawn_compiler_process,
 1811:                            brief,
 1812:                            absolute_source,
 1813:                            report]),
 1814: 
 1815:     %% Test generating a compressed BEAM file. Also cover the redundant
 1816:     %% `beam` option and the `no_inline` option.
 1817:     Small = filename:join(DataDir, "small"),
 1818:     {ok,small} = compile:file(Small, [report, no_inline, compressed, beam]),
 1819: 
 1820:     ok.
 1821: 
 1822: %% Test core transforms and parse transforms.
 1823: transforms(Config) ->
 1824:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1825:     try
 1826:         do_transforms(Config)
 1827:     after
 1828:         file:set_cwd(Cwd)
 1829:     end.
 1830: 
 1831: do_transforms(Config) ->
 1832:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1833:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1834:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
 1835:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
 1836:     ok = file:set_cwd(TargetDir),
 1837: 
 1838:     %% Compile our parse transforms.
 1839:     LinePt = filename:join(DataDir, "line_pt"),
 1840:     {ok,line_pt} = compile:file(LinePt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1841:     ColumnPt = filename:join(DataDir, "column_pt"),
 1842:     {ok,column_pt} = compile:file(ColumnPt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1843:     GenericPt = filename:join(DataDir, "generic_pt"),
 1844:     {ok,generic_pt} = compile:file(GenericPt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1845: 
 1846:     %% Compile a file using line_pt and verify that column numbers
 1847:     %% have been stripped.
 1848:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big"),
 1849:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,line_pt}]),
 1850: 
 1851:     %% Compile a file using column_pt and verify that column numbers
 1852:     %% have NOT been stripped.
 1853:     {[_|_],[]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1854: 
 1855:     %% Compile a file using column_pt and error_location=line and verify
 1856:     %% that column numbers have been stripped.
 1857:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1858:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1859: 
 1860:     %% Compile a file using column_pt, line_pt and verify
 1861:     %% that column numbers have been stripped.
 1862:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,column_pt},
 1863:                                                   {parse_transform,line_pt}]),
 1864: 
 1865:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and error_location=line and
 1866:     %% verify that column numbers have been stripped.
 1867:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1868:                                                   add_columns,
 1869:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1870: 
 1871:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and error_location=line and
 1872:     %% then call column_pt again to check that columns are stripped in between calls.
 1873:     %% and then verify that column numbers have been stripped from output.
 1874:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1875:                                                   add_columns,
 1876:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt},
 1877:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1878: 
 1879:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and en error and error_location=line and
 1880:     %% verify that column numbers have been stripped.
 1881:     {error,[{_What,[{Line,_,_}]}],[_|_]} =
 1882:         compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1883:                                          add_columns,
 1884:                                          add_error,
 1885:                                          {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1886:     true = is_integer(Line),
 1887: 
 1888:     %% Cover transform code implementing the `time` option.
 1889:     {ok,big,_} = compile:file(Big, [binary, time, report,
 1890:                                     {core_transform,generic_pt},
 1891:                                     {parse_transform,generic_pt}]),
 1892: 
 1893:     %% Test exceptions from a core transform.
 1894:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, simple),
 1895:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1896:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1897: 
 1898:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1899:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1900: 
 1901:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1902:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1903: 
 1904:     %% Test exceptions from a parse transform.
 1905:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1906:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1907: 
 1908:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1909:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1910: 
 1911:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
